issues.description:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `activate_kill_switch(string)`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
issues.title: Integer Overflow

issues.description:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `fallback`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
issues.title: Integer Overflow

issues.description:
In the function `claim_bounty()` the following predictable state variables are used to determine Ether recipient:
- block.timestamp
issues.title: Dependence on predictable environment variable

issues.description: This contract executes a message call to to another contract. Make sure that the called contract is trusted and does not execute user-supplied code.
issues.title: Message call to external contract

issues.description:
Multiple sends exist in one transaction, try to isolate each external call into its own transaction. As external calls can fail accidentally or deliberately.
Consecutive calls: 
Call at address: 1462
issues.title: Multiple Calls

issues.description: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function claim_bounty(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
issues.title: Transaction order dependence

issues.description:
In the function `fallback` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to msg.sender.

There is a check on storage index 2. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `claim_bounty()`.
issues.title: Ether send
